content: Barbadian footballer **Emile Saimovici** (born 10 April 1993) is a [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays for [Burnaby FC](/wiki/Burnaby_FC) in [League1 British Columbia](/wiki/League1_British_Columbia). Born in Singapore, he plays for the [Barbados national team](/wiki/Barbados_national_football_team). Besides Barbados, he has played in Canada and the United States. ## Early life A native of [Vancouver](/wiki/Vancouver), Canada, Saimovici is the son of a [Romanian-Canadian](/wiki/Romanian_Canadians) father and a [Barbadian](/wiki/Barbadians) mother. He earned a scholarship to play for the [Oregon State University Beavers](/wiki/Oregon_State_Beavers_men%27s_soccer), but due to some logistical issues, he instead went to their feeder school [Clark College](/wiki/Clark_College). He later attended [Centennial College](/wiki/Centennial_College_(Canada)) in [Toronto](/wiki/Toronto), where he was named an [OCAA](/wiki/Ontario_Colleges_Athletic_Association) league all-star in 2013–14. ## Club career In 2014, he played with [Durham United FC](/wiki/Pickering_FC) in [League1 Ontario](/wiki/League1_Ontario). He later played at the amateur level with [Vancouver Metro Soccer League](/wiki/Vancouver_Metro_Soccer_League) club Vancouver Croatia SC, where he captained them to their first VMSL title in 30 years. ## International career In March 2021, he was named to the [Barbados national team](/wiki/Barbados_national_football_team) for the first time for [2022 FIFA World Cup qualifying matches](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONCACAF)). He debuted internationally on 25 March 2021, in a match against [Panama](/wiki/Panama_national_football_team) in a 1–0 loss. On 30 March 2021, Saimovici scored his first goal for Barbados against [Anguilla](/wiki/Anguilla_national_football_team) in a 1–0 victory in his second international game. ## International goals *Scores and results list Barbados's goal tally first.*No.DateVenueOpponentScoreResultCompetition1.30 March 2021[Félix Sánchez Olympic Stadium](/wiki/F%C3%A9lix_S%C3%A1nchez_Olympic_Stadium), [Santo Domingo](/wiki/Santo_Domingo), Dominican Republic [Anguilla](/wiki/Anguilla_national_football_team)**1**–01–0[2022 FIFA World Cup qualification](/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_CONCACAF_first_round)2.8 June 2021 [Dominica](/wiki/Dominica_national_football_team)**1**–01–1 ## Honours ### Club Croatia SC - [Vancouver Metro Soccer League](/wiki/Vancouver_Metro_Soccer_League): 2018–19 - Emile Saimovici at National-Football-Teams.com - Emile Saimovici at Soccerway - Clark Penguins bio This biographical article relating to Barbadian football is a stub. title: Emile Saimovici
